calculation

Let f(z)f\p{z}f(z) be bounded and holomorphic on the unit disc D={∣z∣<1}\D = \set{\abs{z} < 1}D={∣z∣<1}. Prove that for any w∈Dw \in \Dw∈D we have

f(w)=1π∫Df(z)(1−z‾w)2 dA(z),f\p{w} = \frac{1}{\pi} \int_\D \frac{f\p{z}}{\p{1 - \conj{z}w}^2} \,\diff{A}\p{z},f(w)=π1​∫D​(1−zw)2f(z)​dA(z),

where dA(z)\diff{A}\p{z}dA(z) means integration with respect to Lebesgue measure.
Solution.

First, observe that

1(1−ζ)2=∑n=0∞(n+1)zn  ⟹  1(1−z‾w)2=∑n=0∞(n+1)(z‾)nwn.\frac{1}{\p{1 - \zeta}^2} = \sum_{n=0}^\infty \p{n+1}z^n \implies \frac{1}{\p{1 - \conj{z}w}^2} = \sum_{n=0}^\infty \p{n+1}\p{\conj{z}}^nw^n.(1−ζ)21​=n=0∑∞​(n+1)zn⟹(1−zw)21​=n=0∑∞​(n+1)(z)nwn.

Hence, if we write f(z)=∑n=0∞anznf\p{z} = \sum_{n=0}^\infty a_nz^nf(z)=∑n=0∞​an​zn, then for 0<R<10 < R < 10<R<1, both series converge uniformly on DR‾\cl{\D_R}DR​​. Hence,

1π∫DRf(z)(1−z‾w)2 dA(z)=2π∫0R∫02π(∑n=0∞anrneinθ)(∑m=0∞(m+1)rme−imθwm)r dθ dr=2π∑n=0∞∑m=0∞(m+1)anwm∫0Rrn+m+1∫02πei(n−m)θ dθ dr=∑n=0∞(n+1)anwn2⋅R2n+22n+2=R2∑n=0∞an(R2w)n=R2f(R2w).\begin{aligned} \frac{1}{\pi} \int_{\D_R} \frac{f\p{z}}{\p{1 - \conj{z}w}^2} \,\diff{A}\p{z} &= 2\pi\int_0^R \int_0^{2\pi} \p{\sum_{n=0}^\infty a_nr^ne^{in\theta}}\p{\sum_{m=0}^\infty \p{m+1}r^me^{-im\theta}w^m} r \,\diff{\theta} \,\diff{r} \\ &= 2\pi\sum_{n=0}^\infty \sum_{m=0}^\infty \p{m+1} a_n w^m \int_0^R r^{n+m+1} \int_0^{2\pi} e^{i\p{n-m}\theta} \,\diff\theta \,\diff{r} \\ &= \sum_{n=0}^\infty \p{n + 1}a_n w^n \frac{2 \cdot R^{2n+2}}{2n + 2} \\ &= R^2 \sum_{n=0}^\infty a_n\p{R^2w}^n \\ &= R^2 f\p{R^2w}. \end{aligned}π1​∫DR​​(1−zw)2f(z)​dA(z)​=2π∫0R​∫02π​(n=0∑∞​an​rneinθ)(m=0∑∞​(m+1)rme−imθwm)rdθdr=2πn=0∑∞​m=0∑∞​(m+1)an​wm∫0R​rn+m+1∫02π​ei(n−m)θdθdr=n=0∑∞​(n+1)an​wn2n+22⋅R2n+2​=R2n=0∑∞​an​(R2w)n=R2f(R2w).​

Since fff is bounded and D\DD has finite measure, we may apply dominated convergence and send R→1R \to 1R→1 to get

f(w)=1π∫Df(z)(1−z‾w)2 dA(z).f\p{w} = \frac{1}{\pi} \int_\D \frac{f\p{z}}{\p{1 - \conj{z}w}^2} \,\diff{A}\p{z}.f(w)=π1​∫D​(1−zw)2f(z)​dA(z).
